body:
<!--To help us understand and resolve your issue, please fill out the form to the best of your ability. Feel free to delete the sections that do not apply.-->

**Description of the problem**

Hi, My name is Saneesh, I am a PhD student in seismology. I am new to GMT and was trying to study it by doing the tutorials. When I tried to download the earth relief data from the server, The command ends suddenly without giving an error message and without downloading the data. I didn't understand what is the problem and don't know how do to fix it. 

I am giving the code below. Any help will be highly appreciated. Thank you.

<!-- Please be as detailed as you can when describing an issue. The more information we have, the easier it will be for us to track this down. -->

**Full script that generated the error**

I think GMT is trying to connect to server but some how it couldn't. I didn't understand the problem.


<!-- It helps a lot if you share any data files required to run your script. You can drag-and-drop them here or paste a link to Dropbox/GoogleDrive/etc. -->

```
# PASTE CODE HERE
gmt grdcut @earth_relief_05m -R-66/-60/30/35 -Gtut_bathy.nc -V
gmt [INFORMATION]: Downloading file https://oceania.generic-mapping-tools.org/gmt_data_server.txt ...
```

**Full error message**

<!-- Tip: you'll get more detailed error messages if you add -Vd to your gmt commands. -->

```
# PASTE ERROR MESSAGE HERE
```

**Actual outcome**

<!--The output produced by the above script, which may be a screenshot, console output, etc.-->

**Expected outcome**

<!--A description of the expected outcome from the above script.-->

**System information**

* Operating system: I am using windows operating system and using command prompt to run GMT
* GMT version (`gmt --version`): GMT version is 6.1.1, I have also tried the new version 6.2.0 but the result was same

comments_content.body:
👋 Thanks for opening your first issue here! Please make sure you filled out the template with as much detail as possible. We appreciate that you took the time to contribute!

Please make sure you read our [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/GenericMappingTools/gmt/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and abide by our [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/GenericMappingTools/gmt/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

I run your code and I get the file without any problem:

```
gmt [INFORMATION]: Downloading file http://oceania.generic-mapping-tools.org/gmt_data_server.txt ...
gmt [INFORMATION]: Downloading file http://oceania.generic-mapping-tools.org/gmt_hash_server.txt ...
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Processing input grid
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Reading Data Table from file /tmp/=tiled_84_GX.PD6mXS
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Blend file /home/federico/.gmt/server/earth/earth_relief/earth_relief_05m_p/S90W180.earth_relief_05m_p.nc in -180/0/-90/90 with normal weight 1 [-660-1499]
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Only 1 grid found; no blending will take place
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Processing input grids
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Processed row      60 of 60
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Referencing grid data to GMT_GRID memory location
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for all edges: natural
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for left   edge: natural
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for right  edge: natural
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for bottom edge: natural
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for top    edge: natural
grdblend [INFORMATION]: Blended grid size of @GMTAPI@-S-O-G-G-G-Y-000001 is 72 x 60
grdblend [INFORMATION]: All nodes assigned values
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for all edges: natural
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for left   edge: natural
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for right  edge: natural
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for bottom edge: natural
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Set boundary condition for top    edge: natural
grdcut [INFORMATION]: File spec:        W E S N dx dy n_columns n_rows:
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Old:grdcut [INFORMATION]:         -66     -60     30      35      0.0833333333333 0.0833333333333 72      60
grdcut [INFORMATION]: New:grdcut [INFORMATION]:         -66     -60     30      35      0.0833333333333 0.0833333333333 72      60
grdcut [INFORMATION]: Writing grid to file tut_bathy.nc
```
It is likely an issue with firewall or similar on your end.  You can try to add -Vd to that command and see if you get any more detailed messages that could point to the source of the problem.

Sir, I understood that the problem is on my end, but I couldn't understand what it is. 

I ran the code and this was the outcome. Is there any messages that could point out the problem?
```

c:\Users\Saneesh>gmt grdcut @earth_relief_01s_g -Gearth_at_2m.grd -R75/80/27/31 -Vd

```

Does the direct call via curl work for you?

`curl https://oceania.generic-mapping-tools.org/gmt_data_server.txt `

Yes Sir, it worked. 
```
c:\Users\Saneesh>curl https://oceania.generic-mapping-tools.org/gmt_data_server.txt
98

```

OK, good, and do you get the following as well:

```
gmt defaults | grep GMT_DATA
GMT_DATA_SERVER                = oceania
GMT_DATA_SERVER_LIMIT          = unlimited
GMT_DATA_UPDATE_INTERVAL       = 1d
```

No sir, it's not

```
c:\Users\Saneesh>gmt defaults | grep GMT_DATA
'grep' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
```

Well just run
gmt defaults
and then look for those settings among all the others.

Sir, the settings are same as above. 

```
GMT_AUTO_DOWNLOAD              = on
GMT_DATA_SERVER                = https://oceania.generic-mapping-tools.org
GMT_DATA_SERVER_LIMIT          = unlimited
GMT_DATA_UPDATE_INTERVAL       = 1d
```
Might @joa-quim have any idea what else could be going on for a Windows setup?
Don't know. It's working for me (still downloading files) and I don't see any error message that might guide me into an idea.
Ok sir, I have downloaded GMT directly from the site and installed it. Shall I try any other methods like installing using conda ?
Perhaps you can try use other mirrors (https://www.generic-mapping-tools.org/mirrors/) that are closer to you?

Hi, the problem is now solved. I uninstalled gmt and reinstalled using conda. Now the above command is working without any error. I didn't understand what the problem was, but some how it is solved. Thank you @PaulWessel @joa-quim @seisman @Esteban82 for all your help and support.
Now I am closing this issue.

title: Can't connect to the server
